name: notself
text: A comment left by notself was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Connellingus, Fermatprime, miaou)

name: deimosrising
text: I set my computer to replace any instance of "ghostbusters" with "Ghostbusters"

name: stuart
text: For those of you compelled to hit lame, it is in reference to the alt text, and you do it from Tools -> AutoCorrect Options.

name: farqussus
text: So far there have been one (1) instances.

name: stuart
text: (Office Button -> Word Options -> Proofing -> Autocorrect Options)

name: ratrat48
text: My version on Microsoft already auto-capitalizes Ghostbusters. They must have canged it over the years. we can only hope it is directly due to this comic's alt. text/

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i wish it wasn't the only thing they canged

name: centipede_damascus
text: Lyle seems so depressed to get an answer wrong.

name: mustakrakesh
text: I honestly wish that more Jeopardy contestants would shout FUCK when they miss a question.

name: ghostd
text: I think Alex asking for a high-five makes it.

name: hipjiverobot
text: Because Alex has never high-fived anyone and has no plans to do such a thing in the future.

name: mashuren
text: I wish more people on Jeopardy would shout out "FUCK!" when they get an answer wrong.

name: straw
text: They probably do, but that show ain't taped live

name: saint
text: the editors should let it slip by just once, then. just to kind of buck the system.

name: tekende
text: You know, something different for a change.

name: roybotron
text: Oh really? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cLfOEsrXNP8

name: apocowarg
text: I wish Alex would high five contestants when he got excited.

name: cbtbone
text: I wish most game shows contained more high-fives. Well, except for The Price is Right.  That show has far too many high-fives already.

name: belgand
text: Is there any show that contains precisely the correct number of high-fives? I wish to devote myself to watching it and it alone from now until forever.

name: apocowarg
text: Might I suggest Family Fued?

name: belgand
text: Does it have to be a game show? I'd strongly prefer it if it wasn't. Note: reality shows are also game shows, but magically much, much lamer.

name: apocowarg
text: Entourage seems to have a large number of high fives.

name: belgand
text: Hmm... but it could be possible that it has too many. I need precisely the ideal number.

name: apocowarg
text: Oh forget it, Mr. Fussypants! I can never please you can I? When did the love leave our marriage? Give me the keys to the Tahoe. I'll be at my sister's. Don't call.

name: belgand
text:
But baby, you know I still love you! I think we can still make this work, I'll try to listen more and not be quite so picky.

High-five?

name: greenkoolayd
text: this convo-thread gets all my chubbies for this page.  or one per reply, at least...

name: dallovich
text: Scrubs has a character only for the purpose of high-fiving.

name: deancain29
text: irreverent genius

name: djwhiterabbit
text: trebek breaks jeopardy format at the end there - shouldn't he say "this man once told his wife to 'smile like a donut"?

name: stuart
text: that is the only incongruous thing about this strip

name: slalvation
text: Don't they mix it up sometimes with the doubles?

name: hyetal
text: Yes, but Teodor's answer is in the form of an answer, and is correct.  Plus the reward is a high-five.  As slal says below, the rules are different for Daily Doubles.

name: pettytyrant
text:
whenever onstad draws a picture of a real person I always feel like he traces the image from one of those pothead blacklight posters

i want a blacklight poster with alex trebek i think

name: rotating-dog
text: All rainbows in the background, all weed in his hat?

name: songbirdspectre
text: all smiling, all looking somewhat like a scholar?

name: geysershitdick
text: what does "smiling like a donut" mean?

name: zefiel
text: Think of the activity of tasting a hog.

name: greymantledwolf
text: superb diction. you get a chubby.

name: tetrisattack
text: FUCK

name: presterjohn
text: This is a strip with five great jokes. That is five times as many as you get with other comics.

name: aankit05
text: I count 7

name: cailetshadow
text: actually, 5x0 is still 0.

name: stuart
text: Woah, major diss on every other form of comedy!

name: semiquaver
text: Uh, I'm pretty sure that it's just every other form of comedy that happens to be a comic.

name: semiquaver
text: That totally sounded dickish.  Even pattish.  Astute viewers might note however that I did chubby stuart's comment at the time.  And now, Ranger Bob.

name: iaintnogent
text: what the hell does bisalivary mean?

name: gormster
text: what the fuck is the fermule?

name: rotating-dog
text: I am the basic unit of physics, Gormster.

name: gormster
text: What is it measuring? Physics?

name: relaxing
text: Wrapping a 2003 BMW Z3 roadster so hard around a tree that the heating coils burst through the leather 12-way adjustable seats and embed themselves in the driver's ass, requires on average 500,000 fermules of physics.

name: woodenteeth
text: Another chubby! I gave you one, but you deserved another. Smooth descriptive delivery, takes corners like a dream. As opposed to the BMW Z3.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Quote:
Wrapping a 2003 BMW Z3 roadster so hard around a tree that the heating coils burst through the leather 12-way adjustable seats and embed themselves in the driver's ass, requires on average 500,000 fermules of physics...

which is equivalent to 1 Bummer.

name: softerworld
text:
BI: In most branches of science bi- in composition denotes two, twice, or doubly; as, bidentate, two-toothed.

SALIVARY: Of or relating to a salivary gland.

name: cousinted
text: But-but...Teodor didn't answer in the form of a question

name: 60teeth
text: "Who is you, Alex"

name: stuart
text: "Who are you?", with the emphasis just so

name: stuart
text:
OH FUCK
i thought it would never happen to me

name: rowboat
text: IT [b]HAPPENS[b/] TO [i]ALL[i/] OF US. JUST [s]MORE[s/] SO IF YOU'RE [u]ME[u/].

name: heccibiggs
text:
Well that doesn't make any sense, why would you try to strikethrough the word "more"?


(Chubby.)

name: gormster
text: what would have been much funnier is if you'd actually managed to get all the bbcode right

name: syrupykeyboard
text: Dammit, now I am all kinds of hungry for camp-fire treats.

name: mountaindewtab
text: derogatory!

name: cailetshadow
text: If MS word were a better program it would also automatically put 'jeopardy' in the jeopardy font.

name: stuart
text: Gyparody ironically does a shitty job of approximating the Jeopardy logo at default width.

name: harletron
text: I love teodor's eyebrows, he looks so determined. He knows lyle stands no chance against him, and he means to show him this in the rudest way possible. By getting a high five from Alex Trebek infront of him.

name: salo
text: Philippe is the third player, but he doesn't want to disturb the others while they are having fun and he already waved to his mother twice (just in case).

name: donnatron
text: This comment might be my favorite ever posted.

name: salo
text: That is very kind of you. I hope you have a good day and night!

name: laserblade
text: I actually Googled "fermule" after reading this comic.  Just in case.

name: pzukowski
text: Cool, I got a hit on your comment when I googled "fermule."  But I gave up trying to find the definition.  So I don't believe it's a word.

name: laserblade
text: It's absolutely not.

name: latterman
text:
The hell I'm Cuban and on my best day I'm lucky if I make it to unisalivary. Why is Trebek castigating my people for in the main?

... unless of course, Lyle was actually asking Trebek what "bisalivary" means, to which the answer was "Correct!".

name: ryanfuss
text: I once bought the nintendo 64 version of JEOPARDY! Without ever having watched the show, i felt so angry whilst trying to answer the questions in a sensible way. It also didn't help that i was an Englishman visiting Canada, so the trivia itself wasn't even relevant to me.

name: ssddr
text: Ray Parker Jr. has MS word setup to replace ghostbusters with  "Fuck Huey Lewis"

name: tekende
text: What

name: fineoakstructure
text:
From Huey's wikipedia entry:

Quote:
In 1984, Huey Lewis and the News were contacted by the producers of Ghostbusters in regards to developing the theme song for the film. The band decided not to, and Ray Parker Jr. was instead signed to develop the theme. Later that year, the band sued Parker, citing the similarities between the Ghostbusters theme song and their earlier hit "I Want a New Drug".

name: ham_shoes
text: Another correct answer would also have been "Who was Erik Satie".  Erik Satie.
